did.unittitle: Print No. 815. Engraving: "A perspective View of the loss of the U.S. Frigate Philadelphia ...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "A perspective View of the loss of the U.S. Frigate Philadelphia in which is represented her relative position to the Tripolitan Gun-boats when during their furious attack upon her she was unable to get a single gun to bear upon them." Chs. Denoon del: Engraver and publisher not named. Rectangle. In black and white. Same as Print No. 1076 (colored).

did.unittitle: Print No. 818. Engraving: : "United States and Macedonian Frigates passing Hurl Gate for New York. Being the first British Frigate brought into the U. States during the Late War, fireing a salute as they pass'd."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Artist and engraver not named. Published by P.H. Hansell Carver and Gilder No. 177 Race St. Philadela. 1817. Rectangle. In black and white. Framed in matting boards.

did.unittitle: Print No. 821. Lithograph: "Battle of Lake Erie. 10th of Septbr 1813."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In black and white. Artist, engraver and publisher not named. Below the title, at the sides of a vignette, is a brief account of the declaration of war against England; the American victories on Lake Erie and at New Orleans; and the honorable treaty of peace which followed these victories. A vignette in the center containing portraits of "1. Commodore Chauncey." "2. Com. Hull." "3. General Pike." "4. General Brown." "5. Com. Barney." View of "Battle of New-Orleans" at the bottom.

did.unittitle: Print No. 825. Engraved map: "A Representation Of The Sea Fight, on the 5th of Sepr 1781, between Rear Admiral Graves and the Count De Grasse."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: References below at right keyed to numbers on map. Shows the respective positions of the French and British fleets during the Revolutionary War action off the entrance to Chesapeake Bay. Artist, engraver and publisher not named. Line engraving. In black and white.

did.unittitle: Print No. 828. Engraving: "Sacred to the Memory of Com Stephn. Decatur Late Of The U S Navy..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Sacred to the Memory of Com Stephn. Decatur Late Of The U S Navy. To the Citizens of the United States this Print is most respectfully Inscribed by their humble Servant Joseph How." Monument to the memory of Commodore Decatur bearing the above inscription. Urn at top with small medallion portrait. Allegorical figures at sides of the monument. Artist and engraver not named. Rectangle. Colored by hand.

did.unittitle: Print No. 829. Engraved portrait: "Portrait of John Paul Jones."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Proof before all letters of the portrait of John Paul Jones, drawn from life in May 1780 and engraved by J.M. Moreau le Jeune; published at Paris. In black and white. This portrait with letters is No. 461 supra.

did.unittitle: Print No. 830. Engraved portrait: "Portrait of David Porter Esqr. of the United States Navy."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Small, circular stipple engraving of full-face portrait of David Porter. Published in Paris, Ch. Bance, Editeur, Rue J.J. Rousseau, No. 10. Artist and engraver not named. Circular bust portrait in uniform, without hat. face toward left. In black and white.

did.unittitle: Print No. 832. Engraved portrait: "Commodore Truxton, of the Navy Of The United States."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A. Robertson Pinxt. C. Tiebout Sculpt. New York Published by A. Robertson No. 79 Liberty Strt. & C. Tiebout No. 28 Gold Street. Novemr. 20th 1799. Full bust portrait in uniform, without hat. Head toward right. First state. Oval. In black and white.

unittitle.emph: Olds Catalogue. Supplement 1.

did.unittitle: Print No. 838. Engraving, colored: "View of the Landing the New England Forces in ye Expedition against Cape Breton, 1745..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "View of the Landing the New England Forces in ye Expedition against Cape Breton, 1745. When after a siege of 40 days the Town and Fortress of Louisbourg and the important Territories thereto belonging were recover'd to the British Empire. The brave & Active Commodore Warren, since made Knight of the Bath & Vice Admiral of ye White commanded the British Squadron in this glorious Expedition, The Hon. Willm. Pepperell Esqr. (since Knighted) went a Volunteer & Commanded the New England Men who bravely offer'd their services and went as private Soliders, in this hazardous but very glorious Enterprise." "Engraved by Brooks, London." "I. Stevens, pinx." Published in London for R. Wilkinson. Colored by hand.Extended scroll corners of shell design at bottom.

did.unittitle: Print No. 839A. Engraving, French: "[French engraving of the British Attack on Charleston, S.C., in April 1780, during the Revolutionary War.]"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Artist, engraver, publisher, and date not given. Map in upper left corner: "Plan D'Amboy" View of "Fort Sulivan" & view of "Charles-Town", including British vessels, "Bristol", "Experiment", "Solebay" and seven other ships.

did.unittitle: Print No. 840A. Engraving, circular: "Entrance of the American Fleet in the Port of Alger."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Artist, and engraver not named. Illustration from "The Late War between the U.S. and Gt. Britain", by Gilbert J. Hunt, New York, 1819 (Third Edition). With this is framed a circular bust portrait of Stephen Decatur (No. 703).

did.unittitle: Print No. 843. Engraving: "Capture of H.B.M. Frigate Macedonian, Captn. John S. Carden by the U.S. Frigate United States, Stephen Decatur Esqr. Commander…"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Capture of H.B.M. Frigate Macedonian, Captn. John S. Carden by the U.S. Frigate United States, Stephen Decatur Esqr. Commander.To Commander Decatur, his Officers, and Brave Crew; This Plate is Dedicated with the greatest respect." Painted by T. Birch. Engraved by B. Tanner, Philadelphia. Second state. Colored by hand. Published on October 25, 1813 by B. Tanner & J. Webster. Copyrighted, August 13, 1813. With extracts from Decatur's official letter. Inset: small circular vignette of Decatur, inscribed, "Free trade and no impressment." Second State. Same as Print No. 159, except hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 844. Engraving: "United States and Macedonian…"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Second state of Print No. 160 (same print as Print No. 161, except hand colored), with the same title. Painted by T. Birch. Engraved by B. Tanner. Omits publication and copyright data. Colored by hand. "Extract from Commodore Decatur's official letter: 'At sea. Octr. 30th. 1812...we fell in with, and after an action of an hour and a helf, captured his British Majesty's ship, Macedonian commanded by Captain John Carden'"

did.unittitle: Print No. 845. Aquatint, colored: "Le Combat Naval. - Gloire Américaine..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Le Combat Naval. - Gloire Américaine. Prise glorieuse du Vaisseau Anglais la Java, par la Constitution, frigate Américaine, sur le côtes du Brézil, le 29 7bre 1812; après un combat sanglant d'une heure 55 minutes." Paris, chez M. Guérin vieille rue du Temple No. 75. Engraved by Ambrose Louis Garneray. "Coqueret sc." First State. Grolier No. 83. Colored by hand. See Print No. 186 for second state.

did.unittitle: Print No. 848. Engraving: "A Key to the correct representation of the Battle, on Lake Erie."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by Murray, Draper, Fairman & J. Webster [Philadelphia]. Engraved sketch of the Battle on Lake Erie, similar to No. 241, keyed with 16 numbers to a statement at the bottom giving names & armaments of ships in the two fleets. Below sketch is a copy of a leter from Commodore Perry to the publishers concerning the veracity of the representation.

did.unittitle: Print No. 854. Original silhouette: "Constitution."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unsigned and undated silhouette of the Frigate Constitution in white on midnight blue background. Attributed to William Henry Brown, who did a series of silhouette portraits of prominent Americans, lithographed in 1844 by E.B. & E.C. Kellogg, Hartford, Connecticut. The silhouette includes a small, two masted schooner and lighthouse at the bottom at right, wide paper cut-out border in green of leaf design.

did.unittitle: Print No. 856: Broadsides: "Written and Corrected by James Campbell, late of the Constitution: In Behalf of the Brave Capt. James Lawrence, and Lieut. C. Ludlow, of the Chesapeake. Together with -- Lines on the Death of Lt. Ludlow...Tune 'Discolate Sailor'".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On reverse side: "John Bull and Yankee Doodle". Printed by Nathaniel Coverly, Jun., Boston.

did.unittitle: Print No. 857. Broadside, printed: "Yankee Privateering."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Showing how a little Whale-Boat, belong to Portland, took a large British vessel, and being too proud to come home on the water, jumped on the deck of her prize and rode into Port [Portland?] Printed by Nathaniel Coverly, Jun. Corner Theatre Alley. American Seal in center below title, with woodcut of a sailing ship at each side. The broadside has been cut.

did.unittitle: Print No. 859. Engraved portrait: "Johann Paul Jonas."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by Johann H. Loeschenkohl. [Vienna, 18--?] Circular bust portrait in uniform, cocked hat on head. Face front.

did.unittitle: Print No. 874. Lithograph, colored: "The Road - Winter"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: O. Knirsch, lith. Lith of N. Currier, N.Y. Published by N. Currier. Hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 887. Lithograph: "The U.S. Frigate 'Constitution.'"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lithograph of P. Breda. The litograph is on the cover of sheet music (5 pages) titled: "The Mariner's Adieu; Composed and Respectfully Dedicated to Lieut. Cadwalader Ringgold, U.S.N., by Henry Dielman. Baltimore, John Cole & Son [18--?]. With this is framed a portrait of Capt. Charles Stewart (Second State), engraved by Goodman after painting by Wood, published by M. Thomas. On the last page of the music score are hand-written notes, appears to be a song.

did.unittitle: Print No. 888. Broadside, printed: "Theater ... Jane Shore"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On Thursday September 5th, the theater will present the Trajedy of Jane Shore. Intermission: "A grand spectacle View of the Burning of the Frigate Philadelphia: By the Brave Lieutenant Decatur, in the United States Bomb Ketch Intrepid, supported by the Schooner Syren. The whole designed, painted, and executed by Mr. Turnbull..." With this broadside is framed a small woodcut of the burning of the Philadelphia, hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 889. Lithograph, colored: "États Unis D'Amérique."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lithograph of various American flags and penants. Number "25" in upper right corner. [Paris, 1819]. Colored lithograph by C. Motte from the series titled: "Pavillons Des Puisances Maritimes." Published 1819.

did.unittitle: Print No. 890. Engraving, colored: "Prise d'un Vaisseau Anglais par un Vaisseau Américain."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Paris, 18--?]. Engraved by L.P. Debucourt. First State. "Dessiné par Garneray [Ambrose Louis]. Depicts engagement between the "Constitution" and the "Guerrière". Colored by hand. Print No. 132 is a second state of this print.

did.unittitle: Print No. 891. Engraving: "Commodore Perry's Victory on Lake Erie,..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Commodore Perry's Victory on Lake Erie,Over the British Fleet, commanded by Commodore Barclay, Sept. the 10th. 1813." John Warner Barber, engraver [J.W.B. in plate]. Published by A. Reed & Co.,East Windsor,Conn., April 1814. Duplicate of Print No. 256, except in black & white.

did.unittitle: Print No. 892. Lithograph, colored: "Combat De La Corvette Anglaise La Vénus contre une frégate Americaine."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "No. 34" in upper margin. F. Perrot del. Lith. de Turgis, rue Serpente, 10, Paris. Publisher is also listed in New York, Leonard St., 99. First State. See Print No. 364 for Second State. Hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 896. Engraving, colored: "Frégate américaine, faisant secher ses voiles."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dessiné d'apres Nature et Gravé par Baugean. Depiction of an American frigate at anchor, drying her sails. "4" in upper right corner.

did.unittitle: Print No. 900. Lithograph, colored: "The Yankee Tar."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lithographed and published by J. Baillie, 118 Nassau St., N.Y. Printed ditty: "A Yankee ship and a Yankee crew, Tally hi ho! you know! Ne'er strikes to a foe while the sky is blue, or a Tar's a loft and alow." View of the action between the "Constitution" and the "Guerriére" in the distance at the left. Colored by hand.

did.unittitle: Print No. 901. Engraving, circular: "The US Frigate Constitution, Isaac Hull, Esqr. Commander, Capturing His B.M.'s Frigate Guerriere August 19th, 1812."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One of two small engravings of naval actions on a sheet of 15 portraits of prominent Americans of the War of 1812 period, published contemporaneously by Ch. Bance, Paris. Companion to a small circular bust portrait of Isaac Hull (Print No. 931). Artist, engraver and publisher not named.

did.unittitle: Print No. 905 and 906. Engraving. "A Correct View of the Battle Near the City of New Orleans"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies, back to back on single sheet.

did.unittitle: Print No. 907. Engraving, colored: "Battle of New Orleans and Death of Major General Packenham on the 8th of January 1815."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by Yeager, West., del. Copyright secured according to Law. Published and sold by J. Yeager, No. 100 Race St., Phila. First State. Officer at right of dying Gen. Packenham holding a hankerchief to his face. Bust portrait of Gen. Andrew Jackson in center of title. Engraving is trimmed at the top. Colored by hand.

did.unittitle: Print No. 913A. Engraved portrait. "The brave Brigadier General Zebulon M. Pike, who gloriously fell in his Country's cause April 27th, 1813."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by J. Kennedy. Bust portrait in uniform, in oval, set in rectangular frame. Companion to Print No. 913B, a South-East View of Sackett's Harbour.

did.unittitle: Print No. 913B. Aquatint, colored: "South-East View of Sackett's Harbour."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by Thomas Birch. List of principal locations at left, keyed to numbers on print. Companion to Print No. 913A, Portrait of Brig. Gen. Zebulon M. Pike. Hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 917. Lithograph, colored: "The Sailor's Adieu."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lith. and pub. by Nathaniel Currier, 2 Spruce St., N.Y. Peters no. 1254a. A companion piece to Print No. 918: "The Sailor's Return." Hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 918. Lithograph, colored: "The Sailor's Return."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lith and pub. by Nathaniel Currier, 2 Spruce St., N.Y. Peters no. 1259. A companion piece to Print No. 917, "A Sailor's Adieu." Hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 919. Engraving, colored: "Combat Mémorable entre le Pearson et Paul Jones..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Combat Mémorable entre le Pearson et Paul Jones doné le. 7bre. 1779, le Capitaine Pearson commandant le Sérapis, et Paul Jones commandant le Bon-Homme-Richard et son Escadre." On left, the title appears in German. "Collection des Prospects" on top with title printed backwards. Painter, Richard Paton. Engraved by Balch Frederic Leizel. Hand colored. Companion piece to Print No. 920. Same print as Print No. 77.

did.unittitle: Print No. 920. Engraving, colored: "L'Arrive du Prince Quillaume Henry a Nouvelle York..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "L'Arrive du Prince Quillaume Henry fils du Roi d'Angleterre a Nouvelle York en Amerique 1781. Le 16 Octobre." On left, the title appears in German. "Collection des Prospects" on top with title printed backwards. Painter, Richard Wright. Engraved by Balch Frederic Leizel. Hand colored. Companion piece to Print No. 919.

did.unittitle: Print No. 925. Engraved map, colored: "A Survey of Lake Champlain, including Lake George, Crown Point and St. John."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Surveyed by order of his Excellency Major-General Sr. Jeffery Amherst...by William Brassier, Draughtsman, 1762. London, Printed for Robt. Sayer & Jno. Bennett, Aug. 5th, 1776. Inset map: A particular Plan of Lake George, surveyed in 1756, by Capt. Jackson. This map was issued after the Engagement on Lake Champlain fought on Oct. 11, 1776, although it bears an earlier publication date. See also print of the engagement by Wm. Faden, Print No. 69.

did.unittitle: Print No. 926. Engraved map: "The Attack and Defeat of the American Fleet..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "The Attack and Defeat of the American Fleet under Benedict Arnold by the Kings Fleet commanded by Sir Guy Carleton upon Lake Champlain the 11th of Octr. 1776." Engraved map of the portion of Lake Champlain where the naval engagement took place. No engraver or publisher listed.

did.unittitle: Print No. 930. Engraved portrait: "Andrew Jackson"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Below portrait of Jackson is an engraved scene depicting the "Battle between the American and British Army, fought on the 23rd December 1814 on the west Bank, of the River Mississippi, eight miles east of New Orleans." Engraved by F. Cordon. Published by Busset et Laclotte.

did.unittitle: Print No. 931. Engraved portrait: "Isaac Hull Esqr. of the United States Navy."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A portrait from a sheet of 15 portraits of prominent Americans of the War of 1812 period, published contemporaneously by Ch. Bance, Paris. Companion to a small circular engraving of a naval engagement (Print No. 901). Artist, engraver and publisher not named.

did.unittitle: Print No. 934. Engraved map: "Attack of the Rebels upon Fort Penobscot..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Attack of the Rebels upon Fort Penobscot in the Province of New England in which their Fleet was totally destroyed and their Army dispersed the 14th. Augt. 1779. by and Officer present." Map of the portion of Penobscot River and Bay where the naval engagement took place. No artist, engraver, or publisher named.

did.unittitle: Print No. 935. French lithograph: "Frègate Des États-Unis dématée de son mat de misaine."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: F. Perrot del. Imp. de Lemercier, Bernard et Cie. Published by Victor Delarue et Cie, Paris. "No. 36" in margin. View of a naval action between four frigates. The foremast of an American frigate falls in a close engagement with a French ship, shown in the foreground. Another state of this print with the same title was published by L. Turgis, Jne., Paris. (Print No. 414). Print is signed - "L. Lang." In black and white.

did.unittitle: Print No. 937. Aquatint: "Plate 1. Situation of His Majesty's Frigate Java, Captain Lambert,..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Plate 1. Situation of His Majesty's Frigate Java, Captain Lambert, at 5 Min. past 3 P.M. after an hours close & severe Action with the American Frigate Constitution, in which she was so much disabled in her Masts, Sails, & Rigging, by the Enemy's very superior Force & Weight of Metal, that in the attempt to Board, with every prospect of success, her Foremast fell, & she was rendered totally unmanageable." Drawn & etched by N. Pocock from a sketch by Lieut. Buchanan. Engraved by R. & D. Havell. Published January 1, 1814 by Boydell & Co., London. One of a set of four prints, (see print nos. 937-940), of the engagement between the Constitution and the Java on December 29, 1812. See print no. 181 for earlier state. Colored by hand.

did.unittitle: Print No. 938. Aquatint: "Plate 2nd. The Java, as she appeared at 35 Min. past 4 P.M. ..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Plate 2nd. The Java, as she appeared at 35 Min. past 4 P.M. after having sustained several raking Broadsides from the Constitution whilst closely engageing her, until she became a perfect Wreck…" Drawn & etched by N. Pocock from a sketch by Lieut. Buchanan. Engraved by R. & D. Havell. Published January 1, 1814 by Boydell & Co., London. One of a set of four prints.(see print nos. 937-940), of the engagement between the Constitution and the Java on December 29, 1812. See print no. 182 for earlier state. Hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 939. Aquatint: "Plate 3d. The Java totally dismasted ..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Plate 3rd. The Java totally dismasted endeavouring to Wear by the assistance of a Jury Staysail hhoisted to the Stump of the Foremast & Bowsprit; the Constitution Crossing her Bow in a Raking Position, Compels her to Surrender at 50 Min. past 5." Drawn & etched by N. Pocock from a sketch by Leiut. Buchanan. Engraved by R. & D. Havell. Published January 1, 1814 by Boydell & Co., London. One of a set of four prints. (see print nos. 937-940), of the engagement between the Constitution and the Java on December 29, 1812. See print no. 183 for earlier state. Hand colored.

did.unittitle: Print No. 940. Aquatint: "Plate 4th. The Java in a Sinking state, set fire to, & Blowing up…"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Plate 4th. The Java in a Sinking state, set fire to, & Blowing up. The Constitution at a distance a head. Laying to unbending Sails, repairing her Rigging etc. on the Evening of 29th Dec. 1812. Drawn & etched by N. Pocock from a sketch by Lieut. Buchanan. Engraved by R. & D. Havell. Published January 1, 1814 by Boydell & Co., London. One of a set of four prints (see print nos. 937-940) of the engagement between the Constitution and the Java on December 29, 1812. See print no. 184 for earlier state. Hand colored.

unittitle.emph: Olds Catalogue. Supplement 2.

did.unittitle: Print No. 944. Mezzotint portrait: "Iohn Paul Iones"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Attributed to Richard Brookshaw. Portrait of John Paul Jones, Commander of a Squadron in the service of Thirteen States of North America. [London, 1779]. Proof before letters of portrait of Jones. The prototype of subsequent similar engraved likenesses of Jones published abroad. See Print No. 457.

did.unittitle: Print No. 945. Engraved map, colored: "A Plan of New York Island..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "A Plan of New York Island, part of Long Island &ce. showing the Position of the American and British Armies, before, at, and after the engagement on the Heights, August 27th 1776." At top: "Engraved for Washingtons Life" "Plate II." Drawn by S. Lewis. J.H. Seymour sculp. Published in Philadelphia by C.P. Wayne.

did.unittitle: Print No. 947. Engraving: "Der Siegende Engeländer und der Streitende Americaner."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraving with German caption. "I.M.P. sc." "I.M. Probst. exc: av." Contemporary engraving in black & white of naval action off Mud Fort in Delaware River in October 1777.

did.unittitle: Print No. 949. Lithograph, colored: "Episode de la Guerre de l'Indépendance."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Above title is "13." Drawn and lithographed by Ferd. Perrot. Printed by Lemercier. Published by V. Delarue et Cie, Paris, Place du Louvre 10. Bottom right corner: "Leipzie bei Gebrûdor Rocca". Possibly a different state of Print No. 85.

did.unittitle: Print No. 951. Engraving, colored: "Fregate des Etats unis d'Amérique faisant sécher ses hamacs."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dessiné et Gravé par Baugean. Depicts American ship drying its nettings.

did.unittitle: Print No. 952. Engraving, colored: "Pilote-Bot, petit Bâtiment des Etats-unis, au plus près … Bateau d'Amérique."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dessiné et Gravé par Baugean.

did.unittitle: Print No. 953. Lithograph, colored: "Pirate Attaqué Par Un Navire De Guerre."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In top right corner: "No. 33". Drawn by Ferd. Perrot. Published by Victor Delarue, Paris. Lithographed by Rigo Freres et Cie.

did.unittitle: Print No. 954. Engraving, colored: "Reddition de l'Armée angloises..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Reddition de l'Armée angloises commandée par Mylord Comte de Cornwallis aux Armees combinées des Etats unis de l'Amerique et de France aux orders des Generaux Washington et de Rochambeau a Yorck touwn et Glocester dans la Virginie, le 19 Octobre 1781." A Paris chez Mondhare.

did.unittitle: Print No. 958. Lithograph, colored: "Bass Fishing at Macomb's Dam Harlem River, N.Y."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From Nature and on Stone by F.F. Palmer. Lithographed and published by N. Currier, New York. First state. Peters no. 3225.

did.unittitle: Print No. 962. Engraving, colored: "Combat Mémorable donné le. 7bre. 1779,..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Combat Mémorable donné le. 7bre. 1779, entre le Capitaine Pearson commandant le Sérapis, et Paul Jones commandant le Bon-Homme-Richard et son Escadre." A Paris chez Esnauts et Rapilly, rue St. Jacques a la Ville de Coutances. Statistics of the battle below the picture. Duplicate of Print No. 78, except in colors.

did.unittitle: Print Nos. 968-973. Various items related to the Battle of Yorktown framed together

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items removed from frame in September 2022 by conservator Alan Balicki.
No. 968. "A representation of the sea fight, on the 5th of Sepr 1781, between Rear Admiral Graves & the Count de Grasse [Yorktown]" No engraver named, undated.

No. 969. Woodcut "Yorktown--the engagement between the French and English fleets off Cape Henry, September 5, 1781." By J.O. Davidson. Colored by Evelyn Olds. from Harper's Weekly of October 22, 1881.
No. 970. Engraving. "Reddition de l'Armee du Lord Cornwallis..." [1781?]
No. 971. Engraving. Portrait of Count de Grasse, by Miller, W. Agus, sculpt. [1782].
No. 972. Engraving. Lafayette. Small, circular.
No. 973. Engraving. Washington. Small, circular.

did.unittitle: Print No. 974. Engraving, small circular: "Essex & Alert. Aug. 13, 1812."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Small circular engraving of the two ships, The Essex and The Alert. Illustration is from Gilbert J. Hunt's History of the Late War, N.Y., 1819. Companion to a circular portrait of David Porter (Print No. 830), published by Ch. Bance, Paris.

did.unittitle: Print No. 975. The Shannon Frigate, Capt Burke, Boarding & Capturing the American Frigate, Chesapeake, off Boston, June 1st, 1813 in Fifteen Minutes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In frame and old glass. Color. Printed by W.B. Walker, London.

did.unittitle: Print No. 976. The Pelican Sloop of War, Cap Maples, Rakeing & Capturing the American Brig Argus, on the 14 of Augt 1813, after an Action of 40 Minutes...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In frame and old glass. Color. Printed by W.B. Walker, London.

did.unittitle: Print No. 978. Aquatint: "The Patriot exalted."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Designed by James Sayers. "J.S.f." "Published 15th March 1792 by Thos Cornell Bruton Street." "'Catherine II places in its niche the bust of Fox...A bust of Paul Jones...[looks] up at Fox with a sinister glare.' British Museum, Caricaturues, 8067."

did.unittitle: Print No. 981. Engraving: "A NWbN View of Charles Town from on board the Bristol Commodore Sir Peter Parker Knt. &tc &tc..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "A NWbN View of Charles Town from on board the Bristol Commodore Sir Peter Parker Knt. &tc &tc taken in Five Fathom Hole the day after the Attack upon Fort Sullivan by the Commodore & his Squadron, which action continued 9 hours, 40 minutes." Engraved and published in London by Wm. Faden Corner of St. Martins Lane Charing Cross on Augt. 10th 1776. Key to view is below title. "To Commodore Sir Peter Parker Knt. etc. etc. etc. This view is most humbly Dedicated and Presented by Lt. Colonel Thos. James R.R. of Artillery, Five Fathom Hole South Carolina, June 29th 1776.

did.unittitle: Print No. 982. Engraved map entitled: "A Sketch of the Operations before Charleston the Capital of South Carolina."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published June 17, 1780 by J.F.W. Des Barres. Artist, engraver and publisher not named. Fortifications and locations of British and American forces, and warships included. Inset map of Charleston Harbor.

did.unittitle: Print No. 984. Engraved map: "The Taking of Cape Breton, the 14th of Iune, 1745."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No publisher, engraver, or date is given. (Capt. M. fecit) Below the map depicting "The Isle of Cape Breton" is a key to the battle.

did.unittitle: Print No. 985. Engraving: "The Expedition against Cape Breton in Nova Scotia, 1745."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No publisher, engraver, or date is given. Explanation below title is as follows,: "Cape Breton with the Imperial Fort of Louisbourg was taken (after siege of 40 days)by the New England Forces under the Command of the Honble. William Pepperel Esqr. & a squadron of his Majesty's Ships of War, Commanded by the brave Commodore Warren, afterwards made Knight of the Bath & Vice Admiral of the White." See Print No. 1098.

did.unittitle: Print No. 986. Engraving: "Truxton's Victory."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraving depicts the engagement between the United States Frigate Constellation of 36 guns, commanded by Capt. Truxton, and the French Fregate L'Insurgente of 40 guns, commanded by Capt. Bureaut, Feby. 9th, 1799. Published and sold by E. Pember and S. Luzerder, Philadelphia. Print is the same as No. 96. Full uncut margins. No Washington print is printed on the reverse side.

did.unittitle: Print No. 991. Lithograph, colored: "The Sailor - Far-Far at Sea."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lithographed and published by N. Currier, New York. Eight lines of verse below title. Peters No. 1253.

did.unittitle: Print No. 996. Engraving, colored: "[Engagement between the Serapis & Bon Homme Richard, Sept. 23, 1779]"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by John Peltro. Published Dec. 1, 1781, by John Harris, London. After painting by Richard Dodd. The Bon Homme Richard was under the command of John Paul Jones. Companion piece to Print No. 997.

did.unittitle: Print No. 997. Engraving, colored: "View of his Majesty's ship Mediator attacking the enemy on 12 of December, 1782."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by John Peltro after painting by Richard Dodd. Published, September 18, 1783, by John Harris, London. Depicts three French and two American vessels. Companion piece to Print No. 996 and duplicate of Print No. 354, except in colors.

did.unittitle: Print No. 998. Aquatint, colored: "[The Phoenix and the Rose Engaged by the Enemy's Fire Ships and Galleys on the 16th of August 1776]"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by Dominic Serres. Published by J.F.W. Des Barres, London, 1777. Proof before printed title of the first state of this plate done for the Atlantic Neptune. Engraved from the original picture by D. Serres after sketch by Sir James Wallace. See No. 65 for second state showing the Palisades.

did.unittitle: Print No. 999. Engraved map: "An Exact Plan of Charleston Bar and Harbour. From an Actual Survey."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "An Exact Plan of Charleston Bar and Harbour. From an Actual Survey. With the Attack of Fort Sullivan, on the 28th of June 1776. By his Majestys Squadron, Commanded by Sir Peter Parker." Printed for Robert Sayer, London, 1791. Fortifications and locations of British and American forces, and warships indicated. Survey information of the harbor listed.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1000. Engraved map, colored: "Attack of the Rebels upon Fort Penobscot..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Attack of the Rebels upon Fort Penobscot in the Province of New England in which their Fleet was totally destroyed and their Army dispersed the 14th. Augt. 1779. by an Officer present." Map of the portion of Penobscot River and Bay where the naval engagement took place. No engraver or publisher named. "For the Continuation (after Tindal's) of Rapin's History of Engd. publishd. as Act directs Decr. 18th, 1785." at center bottom. Similar to Print No. 934.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1001. Aquatint: "Engagement between the American Frigate the Constitution, and the English Frigate the Guerriere, surrendered after having been entitely disabled."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Aquatint - blue tints. Title also in French. "Baugean del." "Jazet sculp." "Deposé". "A Paris chez Ostervald,... Rue de la Parcheminerie No. 2." Companion print to the aquatint of the engagement between the "Macedonian" and the "United States" by Baugean and Jazet. (Print No. 1002).

did.unittitle: Print No. 1002. Aquatint: "Engagement between the American Frigate, The United States and the English Frigate the Macedonian surrended after 17 minutes of fighting."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Aquatint - blue tints. Title also in French. "Baugean del." "Jazet sculp." "Deposé". "A Paris chez Ostervald,... Rue de la Parcheminerie No. 2." Companion print to the aquatint of the engagement between the "Guerriere" and the "Constitution" by Baugean and Jazet. (Print No. 1001).

did.unittitle: Print No. 1004. Lithograph, in sepia: "The Capture of H.B.M. Frigate Java; ..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "The Capture of H.B.M. Frigate Java; by the U.S. Frigate Constitution, after an engagement of 1 hour & 55 minutes. American Loss 9 killed, 25 wounded, British Loss 60 killed, 170 wounded" No date or publisher given. May be a later state of Print No. 195.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1005. Engraving: "Aqua Fortis."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Trial proof before title, in black and white of the first of a pair of line engravings of the Battle of Lake Erie. "F. K___(unreadable; Kearny) del." "G. Murray fec't." Published July 25, 1815, at Philadelphia by Murray, Draper, Fairman & Co. and J. Webster. First state of completed print, Print No. 241.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1010A. Engraving, colored: "Madisonville in Massachusetts bay - Essex & her Prizes."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawn by Capt. Porter. Engraved by W. Strickland. Illustrations from "Journal of a Cruise Made to the Pacific Ocean" by Captain Porter, N.Y., 1822.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1010B. Engraving, colored: "The Victory."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawn by Capt. Porter. Engraved by W. Strickland. Illustrations from "Journal of a Cruise Made to the Pacific Ocean" by Captain Porter, N.Y., 1822.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1010C. Engraving, colored: "Commodore Porter."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by Prud'homme after a painting by J. Wood. Second State.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1013. Engraving, colored: "Columbia lamenting the loss of her Son..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Columbia lamenting the loss of her Son Who redeem'd her from Slav'ry & Liberty won While Fame is directed by Justice to spread The sad tidings afar that Washington's dead." Small oval portrait of George Washington is at the center of the print with figures of Columbia and Justice to the sides. No engraver named. Published by Pember & Luzarder, Philadelphia, 1800.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1014. Aquatint, in black & white: "The U.S. Squadron, under Command of Com. Decatur, At anchor off the City of Algiers, June 30th 1815."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by G. Munger & S.S. Jocelin. Published by N. Jocelin & G. Munger, New Haven, Feb. 1816. Same print as Print No. 657, except in black & white.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1017. Engraved portrait: "Commre. O.H. Perry."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No engraver or publisher given.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1019. Aquatint, colored: "Frégate Américaine"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by C.F. Barallier. Drawn by Frederic Roux. Published "A Paris chez BULLA rue St. Jacques No. 38 et a Marseille chez Ruspini". At bottom right corner - "Déposé"

did.unittitle: Print No. 1020. Aquatint, colored: "The United States Ship of the Line Pennsylvania leaving the Capes of the Delaware."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by C.P. Fessenden, Philadelphia.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1023. Aquatint in sepia: "His Majesty's Brig Penguin"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Aquatint - sepia tinted. "J.T. Serres del." "Clark & Harraden sculp." "Published & Sold March 1st. 1805 by Edwd. Orme, His Majesty's Printseller, 5g New Bond Street, London." Vignette.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1024. Engraved map: "P of North America, New England, New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by Herman Moll, geographer. Description of postal service in lower right corner. Published about 1729.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1025. Engraving: "Yale College."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by S.S. Jocelyn after painting by Henry C. Pratt. Published by N.& S.S. Jocelyn, N. Haven, Conn. Second State.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1026. Aquatint, colored: "New Haven, Conn. Comprising a View of the Episcopal & Presbyterian Churches, State House & Yale College."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawn, engraved and published by Illman & Pilbrow, New York, 4 Wall Street.. Engraved in part by John Hill.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1027. Engraving, colored: "Nieu Amsterdam at New York."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engraved by A. Meijer. "Carolus Allard excudit cum privilegio ordinum Hollandiae et Westfrisiae. [Amsterdam, c. 1710] From Carolus Allard's Orbis Habitabilis, Amsterdam, c. 1710. Date depicted: 1673. (Stokes, ICONOGRAPHY, v.1, pl. 14-b, & pp. 219-220). "79" in upper right corner.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1031. Lithograph, colored: "The Farmer's Home - Winter."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Painted by George Henry Durrie. Published by Currier & Ives, New York. Peters No. 2354.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1034. Drawing, pen and ink: "Plan of the Attack on Platsburgh by Genl. Sir George Prevost and Capt. Downie of the Navy..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Plan of the Attack on Platsburgh by Genl. Sir George Prevost and Capt. Downie of the Navy. From a drawing by Brig. Genl. Macomb, and copied by Hardress Saunderson, Capt & D.A. 2nd MG." "Qr Ms Genls Office, 17 January 1815." References in key: A-F, No. 1-8. No scale.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1035. Mezzotint portrait, colored: "Lt. Col. Tarleton."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Painted by Sir Joshua Reynolds...Engraved by J.R. Smith." Published in London by J.R. Smith on Oct. 11, 1782.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1039. Aquatints, colored: 4 small aquatints entitled: "Victoire, sur Le Lac Erie" "Defense de Baltimore" "Victoire sur Le Lac Champlain" and "Prise de La Fregate Anglaise la Java"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No artist, engraver, publisher or date given.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1040. Aquatint, colored: "The Capture of H B M Sloop of War Frolic, Capt. Whinyates,..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "The Capture of H B M Sloop of War Frolic, Capt. Whinyates,by the U.S. Sloop of War Wasp, Capn. Jab. Jones, on the 18th. of Octr. 1812, after a close Action of 43 Minutes. Soon after the Frolic surrended both her Masts went by the Board. She had 6 Merchant Ships under her Convoy." Drawn & Engraved by F. Kearny, from a Sketch by Lieut. Claxton, of the Wasp. No publication date is given. Fourth State (?).

did.unittitle: Print No. 1041. Engravings: Portrait Engraving of "Major Genl. Andrew Jackson." and engraving, colored: "Battle of New Orleans."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pencil notations - on the front of portrait engraving - Bance, Paris (presumably the publisher). On the back of second engraving - "Colored by hand by Evelyn F. Olds in 1950." Drawn and engraved for "Jackson Wreath".

did.unittitle: Print No. 1042. Engraved portrait, colored: "Paul Jones Americain"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Captaine Commandant la Frégatte l'Alliance Celêbre par son intrepidite dans les Combats." No information given on engraver, publisher, or date. Faded writing on border of print. Probably issued in France in 1780. Same print as Print No. 744, except in colors.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1043. Engraving and woodcut: Portrait Engraving of "Paul Jones The Founder of the American Navy." and woodcut, colored "Engagement between Bon Homme Richard and Serapis."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No information as to engraver, publisher or date given Pencil note on back of second engraving, "Evelyn F. Olds colored this print in 1955. It had been partially colored before."

did.unittitle: Print No. 1069. Lithograph, colored: "Enterprize and Boxer."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lithographed and published by H.R. Robinson of New York and Washington, D.C. Wrapped with this print is a letter from Mrs. Electra Havemeyer Webb to Irving S. Olds, from whom this print was a gift.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1074. Engraving printed on silk: "Elegy on the Death of James Lawrence, Esq., late Commander of the U.S. Frigate Chesapeake."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Designed and engraved by A. Bowen. A. Bowen, printer. Elegy consists of 28 lines of poetry. Vignette of monument to Lawrence at the top. Silk has been cut.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1075. Aquatint, colored: "Representation of the action off Mud Fort on the River Delaware..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Action on October 22, 1777. William Elliott, del., engr., & publ.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1076. Engraving, colored: "A perspective View of the loss of the U.S. Frigate Philadelphia ..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "A perspective View of the loss of the U.S. Frigate Philadelphia in which is represented her relative position to the Tripolitan Gun-boats when during their furious attack upon her she was unable to get a single gun to bear upon them." Chs. Denoon del: Engraver and publisher not named. Rectangle. Same as Print No. 815 (in black and white). From the collection of Henry Graves, Jr.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1077. Engraving, colored: "A View of Commodore Preble's Squadron whilst engaging the Gun-boats and Forts of Tripoli..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "A View of Commodore Preble's Squadron whilst engaging the Gun-boats and Forts of Tripoli on the 3rd of August 1804 when they captured three of the Tripolitan Gun-boats & greatly damag'd the Bashaw's Fortifications." Chs. Denoon del: Engraver and publisher not named. Key to view is below title. Companion piece to Print No. 1076. From Collection of Henry Graves, Jr.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1080. Mezzotint, colored: "This representation of the engagement between the United States Frigate Constitution and his Britannic Majesty's Frigate Guerriere,..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "This representation of the engagement between the United States Frigate Constitution and his Britannic Majesty's Frigate Guerriere, which issued in the Capture and destruction of the Guerriere, on the 19th of August 1812, is respectfully dedicated to the President of the United States by the publishers Freeman and Pierie." Published at Philadelphia on the 8th day of March - 1813, by Freeman & Pierie of the State of Pennsylvania. Drawn by I. Hull. From the Collection of Henry Graves, Jr.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1081. Engraving, colored: "United States and Macedonian..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "United States and Macedonian Frigates passing Hurl Gate for New York. Being the first British Frigate brought into the U. States during the Late War, fireing a salute as they pass'd." Artist and engraver not named. Published by P.H. Hansell Carver and Gilder No. 177 Race St. Philadela. 1817. From the Collection of Henry Graves, Jr.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1082. A Broadside: "The Ship Union --- 98,..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "The Ship Union --- 98, Will meet the enemy, on the first Monday in April, with an American Crew...not one fainting lubber among them. Peace, obtain'd by the thunder of our Cannon...not by base submission!". Broadside concerns the Ship Union and her commander, Samuel Dexter, and War of 1812. Yankee Office. Boston, March 1814. Used in the campaign of Samuel Dexter in 1814 for election as Governor of Massachusetts.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1083. Engraved portrait: "Captain Jones Commander of the Macedonian"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by J. Kneass 125 Market St Phila. G. Delleker Sc. Three-quarters profile portrait of Captain Jones. Ribbon in tribute below portrait reads,"The Captur'd Frolick". Vignette. Companion to Print No. 438A.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1085. Lithograph, in sepia and colored: "Combat between the Frigate Constitution & the British Frigate Guerriere."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lithographed by D.W. Kellogg & Co., Hartford, Ct. Print No. 143 is the same print in black & white.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1086. Lithograph, colored: "The capture of H.B.M.'s Sloop of War Java by the U.S. Frigate Constitution."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lith of D.W. Kellogg & Co. 110 Main St. Hartford Conn.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1089. Engraved map, colored: "A Sketch of the Operations of His Majesty's Fleet and Army under the Command of Vice Admiral the Rt. Hble. Lord Viscount Howe and Genl.Sir Wm. Howe, K.Brin. 1776."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published Jany. 17 1777, by J.F.W. Des Barres Esq. From "The Atlantic Neptune". References are below title. Map shows Manhattan, Staten Island, parts of Long Island, New York, and New Jersey.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1092. Aquatint, colored: "To Captain H. Hope,the Officers, Seamen, and Marines of His Majesty's Frigate Endymion,..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "To Captain H. Hope,the Officers, Seamen, and Marines of His Majesty's Frigate Endymion, This Print representing the Action with the American United States Frigate, President, on Sunday Evening Jany, 15th, 1815; off Sandy Hook - is respectfully Dedicated by their obedient humble Servants, J. Burr & G. Ballisat, Gracechurch Street, June 1st, 1815." Engraved by Joseph Jeakes. painted by T. Buttersworth. First of a pair of prints, see No. 1093 for second.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1093. Aquatint, colored: "To Captain H. Hope,the Officers, Seamen, and Marines of His Majesty's Frigate Endymion,..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "To Captain H. Hope, the Officers, Seamen, and Marines of His Majesty's Frigate Endymion, This Print representing the Morning after the Action with the American United States Frigate, President, Jany, 16th, 1815; which lasted two Hours and a half - is respectfully Dedicated by their obedient humble Servants, J. Burr & G. Ballisat, Gracechurch Street, June 1st, 1815." Engraved by Joseph Jeakes. painted by T. Buttersworth. The particulars & the position of the Ships by Lieut. Ormond of the Endymion. Second of a pair of prints, see No. 1092 for first. Same print as Print No. 326, except in colors.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1095. Engraving, colored: "Massacre of the American Prisoners of War at Dartmoor Prison on the 6th of April 1815. by the Somersetshire Militia."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: W. Carnes, del. G.G. Smith, Sc. Salem, Mass. Explanation and key is printed below title.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1096. Lithograph, black & white on sepia paper: "Argentine Fleet, Under Admiral Brown, Dekay Van, Espoora Rear."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "Argentine Fleet, Under Admiral Brown, Dekay Van, Espoora Rear. Defending the passage into the inner Roads of Buenos Ayres on the 27th Sept. 1828. Against the Brazillians, Adl. Norton, his last attempt, before peace." Key of boats follows title. Lithography of Imbert NY. "No. 6" in top left.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1097. Engraved portrait: "Commodore Stephen Decatur."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wm. Birch pinxit. Freeman Excudit. D.Edwin sculp. Entered according to Act of Congress, April 1st 1813, and published at Philadelphia by Freeman and Pierie, of the state of Pennsylvania. Below profile portrait of Decatur is a small vignette of the action between the "United States" and the Macedonian"naval scene with two masted ships.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1098. Engraving, colored: "The Expedition against Cape Breton in Nova Scotia, 1745."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed for & Sold by Carington Bowles, at his Map & Print Warehouse, No. 69 in St. Paul's Church Yard, London. Same print as Print No. 985, except in colors.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1099. Engraving, colored of sepia tone: "A View of the taking of Quebec September 13th 1759."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title and explanation is also in French. "London, Printed for R. Sayer & J. Bennett No. 53 Fleet Street."

did.unittitle: Print No. 1100. Lithograph, colored: "View of New York. From Weehawken - North River."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Palmer, Del...N. Currier, Lith. N.Y." First state. Published by N. Currier.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1101A. Engraving: "Robert Fulton."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Painted by B. West P.R.A. Engd. by G. Parker. Appears to be signed by "R. Fulton"

did.unittitle: Print No. 1101B. Engraving: "James Rumsey's Steam Boats, 6th Nov. 1788...John Fitch's Steam Boat, Dec. 1787. See Rittenhouse's Certificate, page 1075...Robt Fulton's Steam Boat, The North River or Cleremont, 1807."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "From a sketch by Joseph Dyer. Pubd. in Woodcroft's origin & progress Steam Navigation" "Engraved & Printed by Gavit & Duthie."

did.unittitle: Print No. 1104. Etching: "The Takeing of Miss Mud I'Land."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Print shows a female figure as the Mud Island fortress, Fort Mifflin, with two flags on her bonnet, astride a cannon firing on the British warship "Isis"; also show the "Somerset", "Roebuck", "Eagle", and the "Vigilant" of the British fleet at the confluence of the Schuylkill and Delaware rivers. Refers to naval action off Mud Fort in October 1777. From the Harris D. Colt Collection.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1105. Woodcuts: "Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry." "Perry's Victory on Lake Erie, September 10th, 1813."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Woodcut portrait of full face portrait of Perry, signed by J.W. Orr, N.Y. On the back is text from page 146.
Woodcut, colored, of Perry's victory is signed "Barber Sc" and "page 287." is to the right of title.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1107. Sheet of Engravings: "Essex & Alert. Aug. 13 1812." "United States & Maedonian. Oct. 25 1812."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two circular vignettes -- one showing the masted ships, Essex & Alert; the other showing the masted ships, United States & Macedonian. The "Essex & Alert" print is same as Print No. 974.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1108. Engraving: "A View of the Fort & Harbour of Oswego from Lake Ontario Representing the Attack by the British on the 6th of May 1814."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: T.H. Wentworth, del. Illustration from "A Gazetteer of the State of New York," by Horatio Gates Spafford, Albany, 1813.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1109. Engraved portrait: "Paul Jones The Founder of the American Navy."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No artist or publisher given. Appears to have engraved signature, "John Paul". Three-quarters profile portrait.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1111. Lithograph, colored: "A Brief Sketch on the Principle Events in the Lives of William Henry Harrison, and John Tyler, with Splendid Ornaments by Benjamin Owen Tyler."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Designed, written, and published by B.O. Tyler, Albany, NY. "Lith by Baker, 8 Wall Street, NY...F. Grennell, pinxt. Troy." Elaborate poster-sized lithograph with center article of biographies of Harrison and Tyler. Top piece with eagle and banner, "The march westward of Empire takes its flight." Decorated columns down each side. Center bottom vignette of Harrison residence in Ohio.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1112. Engraving, colored: "Combat Mémorable entre le Pearson et Paul Jones..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title:"Combat Mémorable donné le. 22 7bre. 1779, entre le Capitaine Pearson commandant le Sérapis, et Paul Jones commandant le Bon-Homme-Richard et son Escadre." "A Paris chez Mordhare et Jean rue St. Jean le Beauvais No. 4."

did.unittitle: Print No. 1118. Lithograph, colored: "American Historical Portrait Gallery of Eminent Characters in Our Own History."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: 30 portraits of Emminent Characters in Our Own History. Published by A.H. Jocelyn, N.Y. City.. 1856

did.unittitle: Print No. 1121. Engraving, colored: "Vue de New York. Prise de Weahawken. A View of New-York, taken from Weahawken."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ambrose Louis Garneray, pinxt. Engraved by Sigmund Himely. Published in Paris by chez Basset. Published about 1834.

did.unittitle: Print No. 1121A. Engraving, (facsimile): "Vue de New York."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Artist signed [Ambrose Louis] Garneray. [Prise de Weahawk...Paris, 1834]

did.unittitle: Print No. 1124. Aquatint, colored: "To that distinguished Nobleman from whose Precepts & Example the British navy has dervied its present unrivalled state of Discipline and Glorious Preeminence John Earl of St. Vincent, K.B...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title: "To that distinguished Nobleman from whose Precepts & Example the British navy has dervied its present unrivalled state of Discipline and Glorious Preeminence John Earl of St. Vincent, K.B. late first Lord Commissioner of the Admiralty, Admiral of the Red. Lieut. General of the Marines, etc. - This View of the Commencement of the Action between His Majesty's Ship Shannon and the United States frigate Chesapeake, off Boston Light House on the 1st. of June, 1813 is respectfully Dedicated by his Lordship's obedient Serv't. G. Webster." Painted by John Theophilus Lee Esq. Engraved by Joseph Jeakes. Published by G. Webster & Co., London. Sold by R. Lambe.

did.unittitle: Subseries I.B. Papers Related to the Collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The subseries holds documentary material related to the Olds print collection. These include index cards with Olds's remarks made in connection with slide presentations about his collection during the 1950s, galley proofs of his catalogue for the Grolier Club exhibition (1942), catalogues of Olds's collection (1951 exhibition at U.S. Steel, 1952 collection as of that time, and the 1959 Peabody Museum exhibition), labels taken from the prints when they were unframed, and various print matter, notes, and typescripts. The subseries also holds a photograph album and catalogues related to the exhibitions of Evelyn Foster Olds artwork, which was based on images from the Olds's collection, at the Peabody Museum and the Smithsonian.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The subseries is arranged by subject matter.

did.unittitle: Series II. Prints from the Olds Collection Donated by White & Case

physdesc.extent: in flat files and one flat box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series holds about 120 prints originally from the Olds collection that were donated by the law firm White & Case to N-YHS in 2018. Similar to Series I, the subjects of the prints are naval battles of the American Revolution, War of 1812, and Tripolitan War; other military scenes from those wars; portraits of notable Americans, especially George Washington; views of New York City, the surrounding area, and upstate New York along the Hudson River; scenes from America's colonial history, such as William Penn's treaty with the Indians; and a few maps of Virginia and south. An unusual format for this collection is the music score for "Old Ironsides" inscribed to Commodore Charles Stewart by the composer, Charles T. Frey (Item 560).

All the items in the series are listed individually in the container list. The descriptions are based on the inventory provided by White & Case, observation of the object, and the original Olds catalogue to the extent the object could be explicitly linked to the catalogue.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The container list of the series is arranged by White & Case's inventory number. For some of the objects, an original Olds catalogue number was found on the print or frame; in those instances, the Olds number was also included in the container list label.

prefercite.head: Credit Line for Series II
prefercite.p: "Donated to the New-York Historical Society in 2018 by White & Case LLP in memory of Irving Olds."

(c) "New York & City Banks and the McEvers Mansion, Wall St. in 1800. The Residence of Gen. Knyphausen during the Revolution." Lithographed by G. Hayward. For Valentine's Manual, 1856.
